title: Colloquialisms 3
sentences: I'm just idling/chilling in the garden all day today.
He/she always has huge luck with the lottery.
már, tudom, hogy ez nem igaz!
Don't kid/bullshit me, I know this isn't true!
His/her jaw completely dropped from the surprise.
This movie was a total waste of time.
Don't get yourself all worked up over this small mistake!
What a klutz/bumbler I am, I forgot the key!
This thing is very sketchy/risky, let's rather not do it.
You're just yapping/talking big here, but you're doing nothing.
This food is quite likeable/my type, do you want some?
He is a real lucky dog, he wins everything.
eltaláltad a szarva közt a tőgyét
You hit the nail on the head / You got it exactly right (idiomatic).
eltaláltad a szarva közt a tőgyét
Now beat it/get lost from here!
Don't be so arrogant/cocky with me, or you'll fare badly!
That party was top-notch / really great.
He's just fluffing/talking around it, but not saying the essence.
We really got screwed/had bad luck with this trip.
This situation is a total bummer/sucks.
The good weather finally kicked in.
Stop boring/tiring me with this talk!
The guy is totally wasted/done, he drank a lot.
This car is a total wreck/clunker.
He's just idling / being passive (literally: like a jar of preserves).
dictionary:
lábat lógat - to idle / chill (literally: to dangle legs)
mázli - luck / fluke
kábít - to bullshit / kid someone
leesik az álla - jaw drops / to be amazed
időpocsékolás - waste of time
akasztja magát (valamin) - to get worked up / obsessed (informal)
balfácán - klutz / bumbler
necces - sketchy / risky / borderline
vakerál - to yap / talk nonsense
bejövős - likeable / appealing (slang)
rinyál - to whine / moan
mázlista - lucky person
eltalálja a szarva közt a tőgyét - to hit the nail on the head (literally: hit the udder between the horns)
húzz el - beat it / get lost
arcaskodik - to be cocky / arrogant
ott van - to be great / on point
rizsázik - to talk fluff / avoid the point
megszív - to have bad luck / get screwed (slang)
lúzer - loser
szívás - a bummer / something that sucks
beüt - to kick in / strike (weather, effect)
fáraszt - to bore/annoy with nonsense
kész van - to be wasted / exhausted
roncs - wreck / junk
elvan, mint a befőtt - to just exist passively / idle away
